alert.note: Alert for Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 7:42AM EDT until September 03 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Georgia and Upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, in northeast Georgia, Franklin, Hart and Stephens. In Upstate South Carolina, Oconee. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall due to persistent showers and embedded thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the past hour and an additional inch is likely through 9 am. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seneca, Walhalla, Royston, Westminster, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Franklin Springs, Bowersville, Martin, Avalon, Salem, Tugaloo State Park, Lake Hartwell, Victoria Bryant State Park, Lake Keowee, Oconee State Park, Oakway, Fair Play and Vanna. Flooding is most likely along Crawford Creek and Gumlog Creek in northeast Georgia, and Coneross Creek in Oconee County South Carolina. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
